cord.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a piece of thick string or thin rope
cord.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The robe was held at the waist by a cord.
He pulled explosives and some tangled cord from his bag.
cord.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: an electrical wire or wires with a protective covering, usually for connecting electrical equipment to the supply of electricity
cord.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a specific quantity of wood cut for burning in a fire
cord.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: We use three cords of wood in a winter.
cord.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: cord clothes are made from corduroy
